text:
Hi - My name is Vikram Vaswani and I manage Melonfire, a content creation 
cmpany for Web tutorials. In your Apache documentation, tutorials section, you 
have a link to a tutorial called "Getting More Out Of Apache". 

This is a tutorial created and copyrighted by us. However, the credit for this 
tutorial shows "Developer Shed", which is a site to which we had licensed the 
article. If you check on Developer Shed, you will see a (c) Melonfire notice as 
well on it.

Since the Developer Shed article is not up to date and we are the original 
authors of the article, can you please alter the link in your CVS source tree 
to point to our original version and credit "Melonfire" instead? 

The link is http://www.melonfire.com/community/columns/trog/article.php?id=41

Thank you!

Vikram Vaswani
creator: bacchus@vsnl.com
slive@apache.org
text:
We generally credit the provider of the material, not necessarily the
author.  But since you have a more up-to-date version, I have changed
the link and the reference.

thanks.
